entry.title: Twin Pagodas of Suzhou (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Twin Pagodas of Suzhou (pictured) have been compared to ink brushes?

entry.title: Abitibi-De-Troyes Provincial Park (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a voyageur shot himself while taking a gun out of his canoe in Abitibi-De-Troyes Provincial Park?

entry.title: Leland Kirkemo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Leland Kirkemo, the skipper of the ship that recovered the crew of Apollo 13, was played by Apollo 13 astronaut Jim Lovell in the movie?

entry.title: Fedotova and Others v. Russia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in the 2021 case Fedotova and Others v. Russia, the European Court of Human Rights unanimously ruled that lack of legal recognition for same-sex couples violated human rights?

entry.title: 4 Times Square (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the facade of 4 Times Square, made partly of glass and partly of stone, was compared to the two-faced god Janus?

entry.title: Hilf, Herr meines Lebens (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the first prayer of "Hilf, Herr meines Lebens", a Christian song written when its author was age 85, is not to be on earth in vain?

entry.title: Space Encounters (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that 1980's Space Encounters video game was the first that Midway Games offered in their "mini myte" arcade game cabinet?

entry.title: Nicolas Mahler (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a comic award jury wrote that the characters of Nicolas Mahler "have no eyes, no ears, no mouths – but they undoubtedly have character"?
